ISSUE.TITLE: Do not allow an individual to submit a new password that is the same as any of the last four passwords used (compliance with PCI DSS 3.2 requirements)
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Requirement 8.2.5: Do not allow an individual to submit a new password that is the same as any of the last four passwords used.If password history isnâ€™t maintained, the effectiveness of changing passwords is reduced, as previous passwords can be reused over and over. Requiring that passwords cannot be reused for a period of time reduces the likelihood that passwords that have been guessed or brute-forced will be used in the future. This way we should store them (or salt, hash, etc). Let's make it configurable (number of passwords, enabled/disabled) as per this work item (https://github.com/nopSolutions/nopCommerce/issues/2009) let's add an option to require it for users with admin access only Source: http://www.nopcommerce.com/boards/t/38848/nopcommerce-380-roadmap-and-estimated-release-date-lets-discuss.aspx?p=5#159909 Also see related items - https://github.com/nopSolutions/nopCommerce/issues/2009 and https://github.com/nopSolutions/nopCommerce/issues/786
